ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Newbie Bard needs hunting suggestions
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Hmm, Well, I have never had super bad lag in BB, however, I mostly hunted there before I was twisting a lot so we shall see. What I like about it is that
ygData.messageBody:
> I'm entirely unqualified to give you advice, but I would like
> to know why
> you feel Blackburrow is such a good dungeon for bards. I've
> found it to be
> lag-city (2 song max) and have not been able to successfully
> hunt there with
> either my bard, shaman, wizard, or rogue. I understand it's
> a good spot for
> a necro though. But then, what isn't?

Hmm, Well, I have never had super bad lag in BB, however, I mostly hunted
there before I was twisting a lot so we shall see. What I like about it is
that with selos I can bail from all the way at the top of the snake ramp
(unsure what other people call it now) and often make it out of the zone
alive *laughs*. I like hunting the area of the snake ramp in particular,
moving past the door to the chamber between the two commander rooms as level
permits. The other nice thing about it is if you get in trouble chasing a
runner through the ramps around the big hole, you can jump in and make your
getaway. Then there are the Qeynos and halas fang quests, both of which are
really good. Mostly I just think it's fun, in a very rambunctious, stay on
your toes constant crisis sort of way :o)

Tszaaz



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
